Dodge Challenger 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Dodge Challenger 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Dodge Challenger changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Dodge Challenger 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

 1/4 mile 10.5 sec @ 125

The 2018 Dodge Challenger is no mean feat. It currently comes with either of the two most powerful engines available today. Despite it not being as well-rounded as some of its competitors, it offers lots of cargo space and a second row, two rare features in its class.

The Challenger comes in several versions. The GT and SXT are equipped with an eight-speed transmission and have a 3.6-liter V-6 engine that churns about 305 hp. T/A and R/T models pack a 5.7-liter V8 engine that produces up to 375 hp. The Challenger R/T Scat Pack, 392 Hemi Scat Pack Shaker, SRT 392 and the T/A 392 feature a 6.4-litre, 485 hp, V8. The naturally ambitious V8s offer enough power to get the regular car enthusiast excited. They are available with either a 6-speed manual or 8-speed automatic transmission.

The Challenger still comes with the same mature interior and impressive classic muscle car look. It hits the 60mph mark in 4.7 seconds and covers quarter of a mile in 13.1 secs at 108.3 mph. The demerits include a rather too noisy exhaust and a lack of manners in its handling during a soft ride.

The user-adjustable electric steering is available in all trim levels except one, the Challenger SRT Hellcat, which features the traditional hydraulic power steering. The electric system is direct and accurate. The R/Ts come with an improved and optional Performance Handling Package which adds 4-piston Brembo brakes and tightened suspensions. Interior soft-touch materials can be upgraded with a grippy synthetic suede or Nappa leather upholstery. The SRT is the noisiest of its siblings but includes a sound-deadening removal option.

The 2018 Dodge Challenger joins its competitors in providing some of the strongest engines on the road. It’s a powerful sports car that offers reliable performance. It also provides more practicality due to its more massive trunk and interior space. However, it still falls behind some of its rivals and comes at a hefty price.
